comments: a(n) = number of partitions of [n] in which the block containing 1 is of length <= 3 and all other blocks are of length <= 2. Example: a(4)=13 counts all 15 partitions of [4] except 1234 and 1/234. - _David Callan_, Jul 22 2008
references: J. Riordan, An Introduction to Combinatorial Analysis, Wiley, 1958, p. 86 (divided by 2).
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from Harvey P. Dale, Apr 21 2012
